data: As soon as we heard the pleasant news—I suppose the news of an engagement ought always to be called pleasant—it was decided that I ought to speak first about it, and speak to the father.
As soon as we heard the pleasant news--I suppose the news of an engagement ought always to be called pleasant--it was decided that I ought to speak first about it, and speak to the father.
The Whole Family: a Novel by Twelve Authors

Howells, William Dean, 1837-1920; Andrews, Mary Raymond Shipman, 1860-1936; Bangs, John Kendrick, 1862-1922; Brown, Alice, 1857-1948; Cutting, Mary Stewart, 1851-1924; Freeman, Mary Eleanor Wilkins, 1852-1930; James, Henry, 1843-1916; Jordan, Elizabeth Garver, 1867-1947; Phelps, Elizabeth Stuart, 1844-1911; Van Dyke, Henry, 1852-1933; Vorse, Mary Heaton, 1874-1966; Wyatt, Edith, 1873-1958
